sections.text:
This feature introduces “Issue Prioritization v2” by adding a UI layer for selecting an organization or user-specific scoring profile and tuning the weights across key dimensions (Support SLA risk, Product impact, Sales deal blockers). It turns prioritization from a fixed, one-size-fits-all score into a configurable model that can reflect different team goals and operating contexts without changing underlying issue data.

In the issue list and issue detail views, users will see transparent scoring: each dimension’s score alongside the resulting aggregated score, calculated using the currently active profile. This improves explainability and trust—teams can quickly understand why an issue ranks highly and what factors are driving its priority.

The UI will be wired to the saved profiles APIs delivered in GOLD-166 (list/apply/update), enabling persistent profiles at the org and user level rather than ephemeral, local settings. The experience should support a sensible default path where the “default” profile produces the same single-score behavior as today when no explicit profile is selected, ensuring continuity.

Impact-wise, this unlocks more consistent prioritization across teams, reduces manual triage debates, and allows leaders to tune prioritization as business conditions change (e.g., emphasizing SLA risk during incident-heavy periods or sales blockers during end-of-quarter). It also sets the foundation for future improvements like role-based defaults, team-specific profiles, and analytics on how tuning changes queue outcomes.
